meanings.definition: A lens or group of lenses that is closest to the eye in an optical instrument such as a microscope or telescope.
meanings.sent1: The scientist carefully adjusted the eyepieces on the microscope to focus on the tiny cells.
meanings.sent2: She peered through the eyepieces of the telescope to observe the distant stars.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous student pretended the eyepieces were magical glasses that could see into the future.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes widened as if the eyepieces revealed a hidden world beyond imagination.
meanings.sent5: The clarity of the image through the eyepieces was astonishing, like looking through a crystal ball.

meanings.definition: The part of a pair of glasses that is worn over the eyes to correct vision.
meanings.sent1: He always kept his eyepieces clean to ensure clear vision while reading.
meanings.sent2: She chose stylish frames for her eyepieces to match her outfits.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked that his eyepieces were so powerful, they could see through walls.
meanings.sent4: Her world became sharper and brighter as if the eyepieces brought everything into focus.
meanings.sent5: With the new eyepieces, colors seemed more vibrant and details more defined.
